excerpt: This busy 1.5km-long beach features fishing, swimming, various festivals & skyline views.
detail_description: Haeundae Beach is a top tourist spot in Busan, boasting a 1.5km-long white sandy coastline and stunning views of the skyline. It offers optimal conditions for swimming with its shallow waters and calm waves. Throughout the year, various events and festivals take place here, including the Sunrise Festival and Sea Festival. The beach is also adorned with romantic landscape lighting along its stretch, creating a beautiful atmosphere from sunset to midnight every day.
name: Haeundae Beach

excerpt: Picturesque attraction featuring a village of colorful houses, painted murals, shops & cafes.
detail_description: Gamcheon Culture Village is a vibrant and picturesque attraction in Busan, South Korea. The village features colorful houses, painted murals, shops, and cafes. Nestled along the slopes of a seaside mountain, this village stands out amidst the modern skyscrapers of Busan. Originally inhabited by refugees during the Korean War, it remained underdeveloped until its revitalization in 2009.
name: Gamcheon Culture Village

excerpt: World famous market for fresh fish & seafood to take away or eat at the informal stalls.
detail_description: Jagalchi Market is a world-renowned seafood market located on the edge of Nampo Port in Busan. It offers an abundance of fresh seafood, including live, dried, and pickled varieties. The market is famous for its multi-story building housing live fish vendors and restaurants, as well as outdoor market alleys filled with the aroma of seafood. Established after the Korean War, it is known for its high number of female fishmongers and is a must-see destination for curious travelers.
name: Jagalchi Market

excerpt: Popular, curved golden-sand beach lined with tiki umbrellas providing views of the Gwangan Bridge.
detail_description: Gwangalli Beach in Busan, South Korea is a popular destination known for its curved golden-sand shoreline and tiki umbrellas that offer stunning views of the Gwangan Bridge. Visitors can enjoy swimming in the clear waters and partake in various water sports and games. The beach also features a range of cafes and restaurants for relaxation and dining.
name: Gwangalli Beach

excerpt: Clifftop park area featuring an observatory with water views, plus a train ride, lighthouse & more.
detail_description: Taejongdae Resort Park in Busan is a stunning clifftop park area that offers breathtaking views of the sea. The park features an observatory, a lighthouse, and even a train ride for visitors to enjoy. It is located on Yeongdo Island and boasts dense evergreen woodland and rocky coasts with cliffs and caves.
name: Taejongdae

excerpt: Sweeping views are the highlight atop this 118-m. tower with an observation deck & cafe.
detail_description: Busan Tower, located in Yongdusan Park at the heart of the city, stands at 118 meters tall and boasts an observation deck and a café. From this vantage point, visitors can take in sweeping views of Nampo-dong, Busan's old downtown area, and the entire North Port region. The tower also offers special light displays during the Starry Night Fiesta from July to October on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday nights.
name: Busan Tower

excerpt: Founded by the master priest UiSang in 678 A.D., this is one of Korea's HwaEom Buddhist temples.
detail_description: Beomeosa Temple, located on the edge of Mt. Geumjeongsan, is a significant historical site in South Korea. Founded in 678 A.D. by master priest UiSang during the Silla dynasty, it has been rebuilt over the centuries and remains a pilgrimage site and Buddhist learning center offering temple stays. The temple is popular among worshipers, tourists, and hikers due to its scenic location and as a starting point for hiking trails around Mt.
name: Beomeosa Temple

excerpt: Bustling area featuring first-run movie theaters, street food & handprints of famous Korean actors.
detail_description: BIFF Square, located in Busan, is a vibrant area known for its first-run movie theaters, street food stalls, and handprints of famous Korean actors. This district has been revitalized to support the growth of Korea's film industry. At night, the square comes alive with numerous street food tents offering popular Korean snacks like tteokbokki and dakkochi. Additionally, it is conveniently situated near various markets and shopping outlets.
name: BIFF Square

excerpt: Free-admission cantilever walkway with a glass floor offering views of the sea & Oryukdo island.
detail_description: Situated on Seungdumal, the Oryukdo Skywalk is a free-admission cantilever walkway that offers breathtaking views of the sea and Oryukdo Island. This horseshoe-shaped bridge extends over a 35-meter high coastal cliff, providing visitors with an exhilarating experience as they walk on its glass floor and gaze at the ocean waves crashing both in the distance and beneath their feet.
name: Oryukdo Skywalk

excerpt: Lively, sprawling marketplace with vendors selling street food, home goods & souvenirs.
detail_description: Gukje Market, also known as the International Market, is the largest traditional market in Busan. It gained its international moniker due to the multilingual abilities of its vendors. The market offers a wide variety of goods, from home items and souvenirs to delectable local foods like spicy vermicelli and pork feet. Situated near BuPyeong-KkangTong Market, Gukje Market's layout consists of separate areas for different products.
name: Gukje Market

excerpt: Family-friendly exhibits with a variety of sea creatures (most offer play areas & group packages).
detail_description: SEALIFE Busan Aquarium, located just 5 minutes away from Haeundae Beach, is a top destination for exploring the fascinating world of marine life. With over 250 marine species and 10,000 kinds of fish on display, this family-friendly aquarium offers various themed zones showcasing different aquatic environments and creatures from around the globe.
name: SEALIFE Busan Aquarium

excerpt: A cable car & unique pedestrian overpass are the main draws at this manmade beach created in 1913.
detail_description: Songdo Beach, the first public beach in South Korea, offers a unique experience with its cable car and pedestrian overpass. It is considered the best beach in Busan, featuring clear waters perfect for swimming and various water sports. The area also boasts charming cafes and restaurants overlooking the ocean. While not easily accessible by metro, it's ideal for those seeking a quieter coastal retreat or enjoying morning walks along the shore.
name: Songdo Beach

excerpt: Mountain park known for its 129m-high observation tower, statues & stone monuments.
detail_description: Yongdusan Park, located in downtown Busan, is a sprawling mountain park spanning 69,000 square meters. The park boasts over 70 species of trees and is adorned with various stone statues depicting Korean heroes. One of its main attractions is the iconic Busan Tower, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city. Visitors can explore galleries and souvenir shops inside the tower or leave a love lock as a romantic gesture.
name: Yongdusan Park

detail_description: Located in the Haeundae L City Landmark Tower, BUSAN X the SKY offers breathtaking panoramic views of Busan's famous landmarks such as Gwangan Bridge and Marine City. The observatory provides an opportunity to enjoy the wide ocean view of Haeundae and the splendid cityscape of Busan. Visitors can also experience Sky Cruise, a high-speed elevator ride that offers a thrilling journey to the 100th floor with multimedia graphics entertainment.
name: BUSAN X the SKY

excerpt: Mountainside Buddhist temple & hiking destination known for its relief carvings on the cliff walls.
detail_description: Seokbulsa is a serene Buddhist temple nestled in the mountains of Busan, offering a unique hiking experience and stunning relief carvings on the cliff walls. Located in Geumgang Park in Buk-gu, reaching the temple involves taking a scenic cable car ride followed by a picturesque hike through evergreen woodlands via the South Gate of Geumjeongsanseong Fortress. The journey itself is an adventure, with the cable car providing breathtaking views of Busan amidst lush greenery.
name: Seokbulsa

detail_description: Seomyeon is the ultimate commercial hub in Busan, offering a plethora of shopping opportunities with over 600 shops and stores selling a wide range of products. It's not just about shopping though; the district also boasts numerous restaurants, bookstores, and multiplex theaters, making it a magnet for tourists seeking both retail therapy and entertainment. Additionally, Seomyeon's central location and excellent public transportation connections make it an ideal base for first-time visitors to explore Busan.
name: Seomyeon
address: 지하 730 Jungang-daero, Busanjin District, Busan, South Korea

detail_description: The Busan Cinema Center, established in 2012, is the primary location for the renowned Busan International Film Festival (BIFF). Comprising of three distinct buildings - Cine Mountain, BIFF Hill, and Double Cone - it stands out as a pioneering cultural complex that seamlessly integrates movie theaters and a performing arts center. The main building, Cine Mountain, houses three theaters showcasing films while the Haneulyeon Theater hosts top-notch stage performances.
name: Busan Cinema Center

detail_description: Songjeong Beach is a surfer's paradise with shallow waters, gentle waves, and warm temperatures making it ideal for surfing all year round. It's a more secluded option compared to other beaches in the area. The beach offers a view of the ocean and is home to Gudeokpo Cafe Street where visitors can enjoy hand-drip coffee and desserts.
name: Songjeong Beach

detail_description: Taejongdae is a must-visit destination for adventurous food enthusiasts. The Clam Tents, particularly Tent #5, offer an exotic dining experience that promises to tantalize the taste buds. However, this unique culinary adventure comes with a price tag of $50 and is not recommended for those with a delicate constitution.
name: Taejongdae

detail_description: Dadaepo Beach is a charming destination in Busan, known for its sandy shores and refreshing waters. It's a great place to indulge in water activities and relax by the sea. The beach offers various water sports and games, making it perfect for a fun-filled day out. Situated in the southwest of the city, Dadaepo Beach is less crowded than other beaches, making it an ideal spot for families seeking a peaceful retreat.
name: Dadaepo Beach
address: 680 Dadae-ro, Dadae-dong, Saha-gu, Busan, South Korea

excerpt: Airy, sleek venue featuring an exhibition room for modern art, children's museum & sculpture garden.
detail_description: The Busan Museum of Art is a spacious and modern venue that showcases contemporary art, a children's museum, and a sculpture garden. The museum also plays a crucial role in preserving the traditional culture of the city by housing relics obtained through excavation efforts and private donations. With seven exhibition rooms spread across three floors, visitors can explore artifacts dating back to the prehistoric era.
name: Busan Museum of Art

excerpt: 72.5-m-long ocean observation pier in the shape of a blue dragon, with village & lighthouse views.
detail_description: Cheongsapo Daritdol Observatory is a stunning 72.5-meter-long ocean observation pier that resembles a blue dragon and offers picturesque views of the village and lighthouse. It was constructed in 2017 as the newest over-the-sea walkway in Busan, providing an alternative to the crowded Oryukdo and Songdo areas. The observatory bridge extends out into the East Sea, offering a lovely setting for sunset viewing.
name: Cheongsapo Daritdol Observatory
address: 산3-9 Jung-dong, Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea

excerpt: Arty, regenerated cultural village with narrow alleys, street murals & a waterside walking path.
detail_description: Huinnyeoul Culture Village is a charming and revitalized cultural village located near the beach. The narrow alleys are adorned with vibrant street murals, and there's a delightful waterside walking path to explore. While the rocky beach may not be suitable for lounging, the picturesque walk offers plenty of photo opportunities and cute cafes to visit. Visitors can enjoy stunning sea views, browse through small shops selling vintage items, and savor local food from unmanned ramen and coffee stalls.
name: Huinnyeoul Culture Village

excerpt: Waterfront park & picnic destination with bridge views, plenty of seating & regular events.
detail_description: Millak Waterside Park in Busan, South Korea, is a popular waterfront destination offering stunning views of the Gwangalli sunset. As Korea's first waterfront park, it attracts thousands of visitors daily who come to enjoy picnics, street food, and ocean vistas. The park features ample seating, shade huts, flower gardens, and a vibrant pathway with rainbow blocks. Visitors can also dip their toes in the ocean during high tide.
name: Millak Waterside Park

excerpt: Stalwart aerial tram, now with glass-bottom cars for views of the surrounding sea & mountains.
name: Songdo Bay Station (Songdo Cable Car)

excerpt: Chic waterfront complex with a yacht club, trendy shops & open-air bars & restaurants.
detail_description: The Bay 101 is a chic waterfront complex located in the Haeundae district of Busan, Korea. It features a public yacht club and marine center that offers stunning views of the surrounding skyscrapers, especially at night. The complex includes trendy shops, open-air bars, and upscale restaurants both indoors and outdoors.
name: The Bay 101

excerpt: Opened in 1978, Busan's history & culture museum has 3 floors of exhibits & outdoor monuments.
name: Busan Museum
address: 63 UN pyeonghwa-ro, Nam-gu, Busan, South Korea

detail_description: Haeundae Blueline Park in Busan offers a vibrant experience with its Haeundae Busan Sky Capsule and Haeundae Beach Train, which have become popular attractions for both locals and tourists. The park provides stunning views of the coastal scenery along the east coast of Busan, as it was redeveloped from an old railway facility.
name: Haeundae Blueline Park - Cheongsapo Station
address: 청사포정거장 2F, 116 Cheongsapo-ro, Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea

detail_description: Lotte World Adventure Busan is a must-visit indoor amusement park, often compared to Disneyland. It's the world's largest indoor amusement park and a perfect family-friendly option for those traveling with kids or looking for fun on rainy days. The park offers an array of attractions and entertainment options suitable for all ages.
name: Lotte World Adventure Busan

excerpt: Popular recreation site with hiking, rock cliffs, wooden steps & views of the city & mountains.
detail_description: Igidae is a popular coastal walkway located near Gwangan Bridge and Gwangalli Beach. The nearly 5-kilometer trail offers stunning views of the city and mountains, with dense forest on one side and sea cliffs on the other. Once a military path, it now attracts nature lovers seeking relaxation and panoramic vistas. Pedestrian bridges traverse the dense trees along the seaside trail, making it a favored spot for winter hikes.
name: Igidae
address: 105-20 Igidaegongwon-ro, 용호제3동, Nam-gu, Busan, South Korea

excerpt: Modern maritime museum with many relics & models, plus an aquarium tunnel & kids’ activities.
detail_description: The National Maritime Museum in Busan is a modern and unique museum owned by the Korean government. It is the largest marine life exhibition hall in the city, reflecting its significance as South Korea's largest port city. The museum is themed around 'Ocean, Future' and features permanent exhibitions covering various aspects of maritime life, including nautical ships, historical figures, culture, industry, science, territory, and marine experience.
name: National Maritime Museum

excerpt: Unique museum featuring large-scale, touchable works of illusionistic "3D" art & many photo ops.
detail_description: The Trick Eye Museum in Busan is a one-of-a-kind attraction featuring large-scale, touchable illusionistic art that provides plenty of photo opportunities. Visitors can immerse themselves in the art using an optical technique called trompe l'oeil, which creates the illusion of 3D objects within the artwork. Unlike traditional museums, this family-friendly venue allows guests to interact with and become part of the exhibits, resulting in entertaining and humorous photo ops.
name: Trick Eye Museum, Busan

detail_description: Cheongsapo-ro is a charming small port located between Haeundae and Songjeong in Busan. As you stroll along Dalmajigil Hill towards Songjeong, you'll come across this peaceful village on your right. The port is known for the convergence of warm and cold currents, creating an ideal environment for a variety of hearty fish that are perfect for raw consumption.
name: Cheongsapo-ro

excerpt: Small museum exhibiting the history of Busan in a building built when Korea was under Japanese rule.
detail_description: The Busan Modern and Contemporary History Museum Annex is a small museum located in Jung-gu, Busan, showcasing the city's history from the late 19th century onwards. Housed in a building that once served as the Oriental Development Company during Japan's colonial rule, it offers five informative exhibits focusing on Busan's relationship with Japan and its colonization.
name: Busan Modern and Contemporary History Museum Annex

excerpt: Vibrant, covered market featuring produce, local foods, clothes & street-food vendors.
detail_description: Bupyeong Kkangtong Market is a bustling and colorful covered market that offers a wide variety of goods and street food. During the day, visitors can browse through the dry and wet sections to purchase essentials like produce, local foods, and clothing. As evening falls, the market transforms into a vibrant food street with tantalizing aromas wafting through the air.
name: Bupyeong Kkangtong Market

excerpt: United Nations cemetery for fallen Korean War soldiers with many national flags & a wall of names.
detail_description: The UN Memorial Cemetery in Korea is a solemn and expansive tribute to the soldiers from 16 different countries who lost their lives during the Korean War. The cemetery features various national monuments, including those dedicated to Turkey, Greece, Australia, and the British Commonwealth. Additionally, it includes a Memorial Service Hall and Memorabilia Hall. This site serves as a poignant reminder of the sacrifices made by UN soldiers during this historic conflict.
name: UN Memorial Cemetery in Korea
address: 93 UN pyeonghwa-ro, Nam-gu, Busan, South Korea

detail_description: SPA LAND Centum City is a massive spa located within the Shinsegae department store complex in Busan, South Korea. Originally planned as a water park, it was transformed into a sprawling spa when natural underground hot springs were discovered. The facility boasts themed spa rooms such as the Wave Dream Room, SEV Room emitting health-promoting electrons, and Salt Room filled with Himalayan sea salt, all fed by healing spring water.
name: SPA LAND Centum City
address: 35 Centum nam-daero, Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea

excerpt: Winding walkway at Songdo Beach, with views of a lighthouse & a cable car line overhead.
detail_description: Songdo Cloud Trails is a 2km-long trail located next to the Songdo Cable Car station that offers great views of Yeongdo Island and the lighthouse. It's popular with tourists who enjoy walking and soaring over the sea.
name: Songdo Cloud Trails

detail_description: Gwangbokdong Food Street in Busan is a must-visit for foodies. The narrow lane is lined with food vendors run by Korean grandmas offering delicious and affordable milmyeon and bibimyeon. This spot is perfect for trying out unique street foods, from the traditional bungeo-ppang to more unusual items like hot bar (deep-fried fish paste cake) and frozen beer.
name: Changseon-dong Food Alley (Changseon-dong Meogjja-golmok)

detail_description: LOTTE Department Store Busan Main, also known as the Gwangbok Branch, offers a unique shopping experience with its seaside location and stunning views. The massive complex features eleven stories filled with a wide range of products including clothes, cosmetics, sporting goods, and jewelry. Additionally, visitors can enjoy dining options on the ninth floor and catch a movie at Lotte Cinema on the top two floors.
name: LOTTE Department Store Busan Main
address: 772 Gaya-daero, Busanjin District, Busan, South Korea

detail_description: The Songdo Yonggung Suspension Bridge is a thrilling add-on attraction to the Busan Air Cruise cable car experience. For a small fee, visitors can walk across this short suspension bridge that offers breathtaking views of Songdo, Amnam Park Coastal trail, the cable cars, and Songdo Beach. The bridge connects Amnan Park with Dongseom Island and provides stunning vistas of the Busan AirCruise, high-rise buildings, and the beautiful coastline.
name: Songdo Yonggung Suspension Bridge

detail_description: Nampo, located in the heart of Busan, is a bustling shopping district with distinct alleys dedicated to specific products. Kang-tong Gol-mok offers bargain market items, while Vintage Clothes Alley is a chaotic mix of second-hand clothing. Book Alley is a haven for book lovers and Gukje Market specializes in international goods.
name: Nampo
address: 12 구덕로 지하, Jung-gu, Busan, South Korea

detail_description: Jeonpo Cafe Street is a charming and vibrant area in Busan, South Korea, known for its trendy and cozy cafes. The street is lined with an eclectic mix of coffee shops, each with its own unique atmosphere and style. Visitors can explore the diverse range of cafes offering everything from artisanal coffee to decadent desserts. Whether you're a caffeine connoisseur or simply looking for a relaxing spot to unwind, Jeonpo Cafe Street has something for everyone.
name: Jeonpo Cafe Street

detail_description: Shinsegae Centum City is not just a shopping destination, but a massive complex spanning over 125,000 square meters. It offers an array of attractions including a sprawling spa, golf course, ice rink, and multiplex cinema. Recognized by the Guinness Book of World Records as the largest department store globally, it's a must-visit for any tourist.
name: Shinsegae Centum City

excerpt: Small, foliage-covered island with a rocky coastline, scenic overlooks & a park with paved walkways.
detail_description: Dongbaekseom Island, located near Haeundae Beach in Busan, is a small foliage-covered island with a rocky coastline and scenic overlooks. It was originally an island but has been connected to the land over time due to sedimentation. The area has historical significance as it was once visited by poets and calligraphers seeking inspiration from its magnificent scenery harmonized with the sea and forest.
name: Dongbaekseom

excerpt: Expansive beach with lively crowds & convenient access to a variety of hotels, cafes & restaurants.
detail_description: Haeundae Beach, located in the Haeundae District of Busan, is a bustling and vibrant coastal destination. This 1.5-kilometer stretch of sandy shoreline is lined with an array of hotels, cafes, and restaurants, making it convenient for visitors to enjoy their time by the sea. The beach faces south, allowing for rolling waves and creating a picturesque setting.
name: Haeundae Beach
address: 264 Haeundaehaebyeon-ro, 중제1동, Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea

excerpt: This iconic bridge dating back to the 1930s features sides that lift to allow ships to pass through.
detail_description: Yeongdo Bridge, an iconic structure dating back to the 1930s, is a popular tourist attraction in Busan. This historic bridge connects Nampodong to Yeongdo Island and offers magnificent views of Jagalchi Market. As the first bascule bridge in Korea, it has sides that lift to allow ships to pass through, providing visitors with a unique experience.
name: Yeongdo Bridge

detail_description: Pusan National University, also known as PNU, is situated in the downtown area of Busan. This vibrant neighborhood offers a variety of entertainment options including bars, affordable dining, and a lively nightlife scene. The university's main campus is conveniently located in the north-central part of the city, making it easily accessible to many attractions within the city center. While PNU is renowned for its high-quality education, some find that the environment may not be as accommodating to international students.
name: Pusan National University

excerpt: Extensive, indoor mixed-gender spa featuring natural hot spring water & a Japanese restaurant.
detail_description: Located in the Hotel Nongshim in Busan, South Korea, Hurshimchung Spa is a renowned indoor mixed-gender spa that has been operating since 1991. The spa offers a wide range of facilities including soaking spas, saunas, gym house, Japanese restaurant and rejuvenating common baths. It is particularly popular among foreigners due to its natural hot spring water fountain and various amenities such as swimming pools, waterfalls and Jacuzzis.
name: 허심청 온천탕
